From: "Carnage darkness" <carnage_blood@...>

Carnage: Steph, I will not RP Teltoli while you are gone, I would rather 
wait until you recover and am in no hurry. Besides, I would rather have your 
real thoughts and personality behind her then my own.)

** Carnage gave a final heave and threw dirt back before she leaned back 
against her hind legs and looked at the work she had done, judging with 
nothing but bare eye that it was deep enough to keep the meat dry and fresh 
for another 48 hours.
She looked up towards Teltoli as she heard the woman claim that she did want 
what she had asked for, moving stiffly and heaving one of the dead pigs into 
the hole while she listened.
So, Teltoli wanted to become a soldier just to prove to people that she 
wasn't a child anymore? Well...that was the wrong reason.
When you ask for something like she was there has to be more of a reason 
then to prove something. The pain wasn't worth something so small.
Carnage leaned over and heaved the second dead beast into the hole, then 
turning to the pile of dirt just behind her, judging the distance between 
the hole and pile and then positioning herself so that the pile was behind 
her. So with her hind claws she began to throw the dirt between her legs and 
towards the  hole. It wasn't long before the pigs were both covered and 
Carnage was over by the trunk where the hole had been, patting the soil so 
that it became compact and no water would be able to get as far as her meals 
were lying.
She sighed and sat back a bit, resting her weight on her hind legs. She had 
been thinking about what Teltoli had said the whole time she had been 
working, and had finally decided on what she knew was the right answer.** " 
No. I won't teach you if all you want is a title for yourself." ** Carnage 
glanced up through the leaves of the tree and towards the sky, the rain 
continuing to fall. It really bothered her but if the ground werenï¿½t covered 
with something where her meals were then they would be soaked. So she did 
the best thing that she knew, she walked over to the fresh dirt and settled 
herself upon it like a hen on her nest. Shifting here and there until she 
was comfortable.
Carnage glanced at Teltoli and then motioned with her snout to a spot beside 
her, since she knew it was going to be a cold night...even for a fur covered 
cat with wings.
Anything Teltoli wanted to know as why she wouldn't teach her was welcome to 
be questioned, besides, Carnage had always liked determination.**
